title: 4 homeless men appear to have been killed with a metal object in New York City's Chinatown while they were sleeping
text:
At least four apparently homeless men were killed in the early hours of Saturday morning after they were attacked with a metal object, authorities announced.

A 24-year-old man who is also believed to be homeless was taken into custody after he was reportedly found near the location of the first attack with a metal object.

An additional fifth victim was taken to a nearby hospital with critical injuries. Investigations into the details surrounding the attacks were ongoing Saturday morning.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

At least four apparently homeless men in New York City's Chinatown were killed in the early hours of Saturday morning after they were attacked with a metal object, New York City authorities announced.

An additional fifth victim was taken to a nearby hospital with critical injuries, The New York Times reported, citing New York Police Department spokesman Lt. Thomas Antonetti.

A 24-year-old man was taken into custody after he was reportedly found near the location of the first attack with a metal object. He is also believed to be homeless, according to the New York Daily News.

The Daily News reported that police responded to a report of an assault around 1:50 a.m., but found a 49-year-old homeless man on the ground with a massive head wound and another man dead next to him.

The injured man was then taken to the hospital before police found two other homeless men within a few blocks dead from similar head wounds, the Daily News reported. A third dead homeless man was also found in the area.

The New York Post cited a source that said the attacker had used "a three-foot, blood-covered metal object that appeared to be from a construction site," but authorities had not released additional details about the weapon.

Police conducted ongoing investigations at the scenes Saturday morning as details on motivation for the attacks were not immediately available.
